head.abstracts: This paper presents a lossless image coding approach that produces an embedded bit-stream optimized for L∞-constrained decoding. The decoder is implementable using only integer arithmetic and is able to deduce from the bit-stream the L∞ error that affects the reconstructed image at an arbitrary point of decoding. The lossless coding performance is compared with JPEG-LS and JPEG2000. Operational rate-distortion curves, in the L∞ sense, are presented and compared with JPEG2000.

classification.classification-description: Combinatorial Mathematics, Includes Graph Theory, Set Theory
